page.title: 08ALLOTMENTS
page.content: There are many allotments in upper Norward. An allotment is a small piece of ground where people grow flowers, fruit and vegetables. Some of the people have gardens but need more space while others have no garden and rely on allotments for growing things. On their allotments people grow a variety of vegetables including cabbeges, carrots, potatoes, leeks, radishes and tomatoes. Most of the people we interviewed were retired and so had time to spend on there allotments. One man had had his allotment since 1952. People spent an average of 3 hours a day on their allotments but one man spent at least 7 hours a day. For most of the people we interviewed, having an allotment was a hobby.
